import json
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql import DataFrame
from pyspark.sql import functions as F
import pprint
The below testings ar eregarding tracing records accross data tables in Horizon s78 (phase 1).

%%sql
SELECT distinct count(*) FROM odw_standardised_db.horizoncases_s78
--SELECT distinct count(*) FROM odw_standardised_db.casedocumentdatesdates

# I have beeen using casenodeid = '7506749'  for horizoncase_s78 ,cases_specialisms(accordingly the specific one casereference = '2163206'), vw_case_dates,casedocumentdatesdates,casesitestrings,vw_addadditionaldata caseuniqueid=2163206 , vw_additionalfields for the below cheks.

%%sql
SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[horizoncases_s78]
SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[cases_specialisms] 

SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[casesitestrings]
where casenodeid = '7506749'

SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[casedocumentdatesdates]

SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[typeofprocedure]
SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[horizon_typeofreasonforcase]
SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_case_dates]
SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_addadditionaldata]
SELECT distinct(count(*)), count(*) as c FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_additionalfields]

SELECT caseuniqueid, COUNT(*)
FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[horizoncases_s78]
GROUP BY caseuniqueid
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT *
FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[horizoncases_s78]
where casereference ='APP/A2280/W/18/3207347'



select * from  [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[horizoncases_s78]

where caseuniqueid =  '2163206'
 in ( select DISTINCT casereference FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[cases_specialisms] )

select *  FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[cases_specialisms]
where casereference = '2163206'

select distinct casespecialism FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[cases_specialisms]

select * from  [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[horizoncases_s78]
where casenodeid = '7506749'
where casenodeid  in ( select DISTINCT casenodeid FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_case_dates]) and  caseuniqueid =  '2163206'
select DISTINCT casenodeid FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_case_dates]
where 

select * FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_case_dates]
where casenodeid = '7506749'

select casenodeid, count(*) FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_case_dates]
GROUP BY casenodeid
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

select * FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[casesitestrings]
where casenodeid = '7506749'

select * FROM [odw_standardised_db].[dbo].[vw_addadditionaldata]
where appealrefnumber = '2163206'

    SELECT 1 
    FROM tbl 
    GROUP BY {primary_k} 
    HAVING COUNT(*) > 1 
    LIMIT 1
